H0.text: Friction is the force that causes a bicycle to slow down when the brakes are used.

H1.text: Electricity is the force that causes a bicycle to slow down when the brakes are used.

H2.text: Gravity is the force that causes a bicycle to slow down when the brakes are used.

H3.text: Magnetism is the force that causes a bicycle to slow down when the brakes are used.

A4.text: Braking friction is used to slow and stop vehicles by generating a large retarding force.

A5.text: The force of friction is always exerted in a direction that opposes movement (for kinetic friction) or potential movement (for static friction) between the two surfaces.
